standard_metadata.standard_description: Use facts about supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles in a multi-step problem to write and solve simple equations for an unknown angle in a figure.

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 4 X degrees. Another angle opposite to this is divided by a ray into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 45 degrees and 15 degrees.

hints.content: The angle with measure $4x^\circ$ and the angles with measures $15^\circ$ and $45^\circ$ combined are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 4 X degrees. Another angle opposite to this is divided by a ray into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 45 degrees and 15 degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{4x^\circ} = \goldD{15^\circ}+ \greenD{45^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 4 X degrees. Another angle opposite to this is divided by a ray into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 45 degrees and 15 degrees.

Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked and labeled as 150 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is divided by a ray into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 50 degrees and 2 X degrees.

hints.content: The angle with measure $150^\circ$ and the angles with measures $2x^\circ$ and $50^\circ$ combined are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked and labeled as 150 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is divided by a ray into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 50 degrees and 2 X degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{150^\circ} = \goldD{2x^\circ}+ \greenD{50^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked and labeled as 150 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is divided by a ray into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 50 degrees and 2 X degrees.

Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked and labeled as 60 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked and labeled as parenthesis open x plus 45 parenthesis closed degrees. The angle between these two is divided by a ray into two parts.

hints.content: The angles shown are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked and labeled as 60 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked and labeled as parenthesis open x plus 45 parenthesis closed degrees. The angle between these two is divided by a ray into two parts.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{60^\circ} = \goldD{(x+45)^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked and labeled as 60 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked and labeled as parenthesis open x plus 45 parenthesis closed degrees. The angle between these two is divided by a ray into two parts.

Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 110 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open 8 X plus 30 parenthesis closed degrees. The angle between these two is divided by a ray into two parts.

hints.content: The angles shown are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 110 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open 8 X plus 30 parenthesis closed degrees. The angle between these two is divided by a ray into two parts.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{110^\circ} = \goldD{(8x+30)^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 110 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open 8 X plus 30 parenthesis closed degrees. The angle between these two is divided by a ray into two parts.
Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 60 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open x plus 40 parenthesis closed degrees.

hints.content: The angles shown are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 60 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open x plus 40 parenthesis closed degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation  Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{60^\circ} = \goldD{(x+40)^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 60 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open x plus 40 parenthesis closed degrees.
Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked 150 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open 4 X plus 50 parenthesis closed degrees.

hints.content: The angles shown are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked 150 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open 4 X plus 50 parenthesis closed degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation  Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{150^\circ} = \goldD{(4x+50)^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked 150 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as parenthesis open 4 X plus 50 parenthesis closed degrees.
Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 120 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as 3 X degrees.

hints.content: The angles shown are vertical angles. Vertical angles are congruent.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 120 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as 3 X degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation  Since vertical angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to each other.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{3x^\circ} = \goldD{120^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 120 degrees. Another angle opposite to this is marked as 3 X degrees.
Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts labeled as 5 X degrees, parenthesis open x plus 54 parenthesis closed degrees and a right angle.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation  All three angles form a straight line, so have a sum of $180^\circ$. Since one of the angles is $90^\circ$, the two remaining angles are complementary and have a sum of $90^\circ$.   [[☃ image 1]]  $ \blueD{5x^\circ} + \maroonD{(x + 54)^\circ} = 90^\circ$.

images.alt: Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts labeled as 5 X degrees, parenthesis open x plus 54 parenthesis closed degrees and a right angle.
Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 20 degrees, parenthesis open 6 times x minus 2 parentheses closed degrees, and a right angle.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation  All three angles form a straight line, so have a sum of $180^\circ$. Since one of the angles is $90^\circ$, the two remaining angles are complementary and  have a sum of $90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{20^\circ} + \maroonD{(6x -2)^\circ}= 90^\circ$.

images.alt: Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 20 degrees, parenthesis open 6 times x minus 2 parentheses closed degrees, and a right angle.
A ray divides a diagonally oriented right angle into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as x degrees and parenthesis open 3 X plus 10 parenthesis closed degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The two angles together are complementary, which means they add up to $90^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{x^\circ}+ \maroonD{(3x + 10)^\circ} = 90^\circ$.

images.alt: A ray divides a diagonally oriented right angle into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as x degrees and parenthesis open 3 X plus 10 parenthesis closed degrees.
A ray divides a diagonally oriented right angle into two parts labeled as 35 degrees and 5 X degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The two angles together are complementary, which means they add up to $90^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{35^\circ}+ \maroonD{5x^\circ} = 90^\circ$.

images.alt: A ray divides a diagonally oriented right angle into two parts labeled as 35 degrees and 5 X degrees.
A line divides a right angle into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as parenthesis open x plus 42 parenthesis closed degrees and 3 X degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The two angles together are complementary, which means they add up to $90^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{(x+42)^\circ}+ \maroonD{3x^\circ} = 90^\circ$.

images.alt: A line divides a right angle into two parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as parenthesis open x plus 42 parenthesis closed degrees and 3 X degrees.
A line divides a right angle into two angles 8 X degrees and 50 degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The two angles together are complementary, which means they add up to $90^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{8x^\circ}+ \maroonD{50^\circ} = 90^\circ$.

images.alt: A line divides a right angle into two angles 8 X degrees and 50 degrees.
Two lines divide a right angle into three parts labeled as x degrees, 2 X degrees, and parenthesis open x plus 10 parenthesis closed degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The three angles together are complementary, which means they add up to $90^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{x^\circ}+ \maroonD{2x^\circ} +\goldD{(x + 10)^\circ}= 90^\circ$.

images.alt: Two lines divide a right angle into three parts labeled as x degrees, 2 X degrees, and parenthesis open x plus 10 parenthesis closed degrees.

Three lines intersect forming angles. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as parenthesis open x plus 12 parenthesis closed degrees, 100 degrees, and x degrees. The three angles line adjacent to each other in a straight line.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   All three angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{(x+12^\circ)} +\maroonD{ 100^\circ}+ \goldD{x^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: Three lines intersect forming angles. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as parenthesis open x plus 12 parenthesis closed degrees, 100 degrees, and x degrees. The three angles line adjacent to each other in a straight line.
Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts labeled 3 X degrees, 80 degrees, an 2 X degrees, from left to right, respectively.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   All three angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]     $\blueD{3x^\circ} + \maroonD{80^\circ}+ \goldD{2x^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts labeled 3 X degrees, 80 degrees, an 2 X degrees, from left to right, respectively.
A ray divides a straight angle into two parts labeled as parenthesis open 2 X plus 45 parenthesis closed degrees and x degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The two  angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{(2x + 45)^\circ}+ \goldD{x^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: A ray divides a straight angle into two parts labeled as parenthesis open 2 X plus 45 parenthesis closed degrees and x degrees.
Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 3 X degrees. Another angle adjacent to this is marked as 75 degrees.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   The two  angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{3x^\circ}+ \goldD{75^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: Two lines intersect forming angles. One of the angles is marked as 3 X degrees. Another angle adjacent to this is marked as 75 degrees.
Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 3 X degrees, 100 degrees, and x degrees. The angles are oriented below the straight line.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   All three angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{ x^\circ} + \maroonD{100^\circ}+\goldD{3 x^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: Two rays divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked as 3 X degrees, 100 degrees, and x degrees. The angles are oriented below the straight line.

Two lines divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are labeled as 40 degrees, parenthesis open 2 times x plus 30 parenthesis closed degrees and 40 degrees. The two lines join together to form a triangle.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   All three angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{ 40^\circ} + \maroonD{(2x + 30)^\circ}+\goldD{40^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: Two lines divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are labeled as 40 degrees, parenthesis open 2 times x plus 30 parenthesis closed degrees and 40 degrees. The two lines join together to form a triangle.
Two lines divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked and labeled as x degrees, 100 degrees and x degrees. The two lines join together to form a triangle.

hints.content: ###Writing an equation   All three angles together are supplementary, which means they add up to $180^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{ x^\circ} + \maroonD{100^\circ}+\goldD{x^\circ} = 180^\circ$

images.alt: Two lines divide a straight angle into three parts. In clockwise order, the angles are marked and labeled as x degrees, 100 degrees and x degrees. The two lines join together to form a triangle.
